verses.kjv: Woe is me! for I am as when they have gathered the summer fruits, as the grapegleanings of the vintage: there is no cluster to eat: my soul desired the firstripe fruit.
verses.ct: How miserable I am! I'm like someone searching for fruit after the harvest is over, like someone looking for leftover grapes after the picking is done. There's not a single cluster to eat; my soul longs for the early figs.

verses.kjv: The good man is perished out of the earth: and there is none upright among men: they all lie in wait for blood; they hunt every man his brother with a net.
verses.ct: The faithful have vanished from the land, and there isn't an honest person left. Everyone plots to shed blood; each one hunts down his own brother with a net.

verses.kjv: That they may do evil with both hands earnestly, the prince asketh, and the judge asketh for a reward; and the great man, he uttereth his mischievous desire: so they wrap it up.
verses.ct: Their hands are skilled at doing evil. The official demands bribes, the judge accepts payoffs, and the powerful dictate whatever they want — and together they scheme it all out.

verses.kjv: The best of them is as a brier: the most upright is sharper than a thorn hedge: the day of thy watchmen and thy visitation cometh; now shall be their perplexity.
verses.ct: The best of them is like a thornbush; the most upright is worse than a hedge of thorns. The day your watchmen warned about — your day of reckoning — has arrived. Now confusion will overtake them.

verses.kjv: Trust ye not in a friend, put ye not confidence in a guide: keep the doors of thy mouth from her that lieth in thy bosom.
verses.ct: Don't trust a friend, and don't rely on a close companion. Guard your words even from the wife who lies in your arms.

verses.kjv: For the son dishonoureth the father, the daughter riseth up against her mother, the daughter in law against her mother in law; a man’s enemies are the men of his own house.
verses.ct: A son treats his father with contempt, a daughter rebels against her mother, a daughter-in-law turns against her mother-in-law — a person's enemies are the members of his own household.

verses.kjv: Therefore I will look unto the LORD; I will wait for the God of my salvation: my God will hear me.
verses.ct: But as for me, I will look to the LORD. I will wait for the God who saves me. My God will hear me.

verses.kjv: Rejoice not against me, O mine enemy: when I fall, I shall arise; when I sit in darkness, the LORD shall be a light unto me.
verses.ct: Don't celebrate over me, my enemy. Though I fall, I will get back up. Though I sit in darkness, the LORD will be my light.

verses.kjv: I will bear the indignation of the LORD, because I have sinned against him, until he plead my cause, and execute judgment for me: he will bring me forth to the light, and I shall behold his righteousness.
verses.ct: I will endure the LORD's anger — because I have sinned against him — until he takes up my case and brings me justice. He will lead me out into the light, and I will see his righteousness.

verses.kjv: Then she that is mine enemy shall see it, and shame shall cover her which said unto me, Where is the LORD thy God? mine eyes shall behold her: now shall she be trodden down as the mire of the streets.
verses.ct: Then my enemy will witness it, and shame will overwhelm the one who said to me, 'Where is the LORD your God?' My own eyes will see her downfall; she will be trampled like mud in the streets.

verses.kjv: In the day that thy walls are to be built, in that day shall the decree be far removed.
verses.ct: A day is coming when your walls will be rebuilt, and on that day your boundaries will be greatly expanded.

verses.kjv: In that day also he shall come even to thee from Assyria, and from the fortified cities, and from the fortress even to the river, and from sea to sea, and from mountain to mountain.
verses.ct: On that day, people will come to you from Assyria and the cities of Egypt, from Egypt all the way to the Euphrates River, from sea to sea and mountain to mountain.

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding the land shall be desolate because of them that dwell therein, for the fruit of their doings.
verses.ct: But first the land will become desolate because of its inhabitants, as a consequence of their actions.

verses.kjv: Feed thy people with thy rod, the flock of thine heritage, which dwell solitarily in the wood, in the midst of Carmel: let them feed in Bashan and Gilead, as in the days of old.
verses.ct: Shepherd your people with your staff, the flock that belongs to you, living alone in a forest, surrounded by fertile land. Let them graze in Bashan and Gilead as they did in ancient times.

verses.kjv: According to the days of thy coming out of the land of Egypt will I shew unto him marvellous things.
verses.ct: "As in the days when you came out of Egypt, I will show them amazing wonders."

verses.kjv: The nations shall see and be confounded at all their might: they shall lay their hand upon their mouth, their ears shall be deaf.
verses.ct: The nations will see and be humiliated despite all their power. They will cover their mouths in shock, and their ears will go deaf.

verses.kjv: They shall lick the dust like a serpent, they shall move out of their holes like worms of the earth: they shall be afraid of the LORD our God, and shall fear because of thee.
verses.ct: They will lick the dust like snakes and crawl out of their hiding places like creatures of the ground. They will come trembling before the LORD our God, filled with dread because of you.

verses.kjv: Who is a God like unto thee, that pardoneth iniquity, and passeth by the transgression of the remnant of his heritage? he retaineth not his anger for ever, because he delighteth in mercy.
verses.ct: What God is like you, who forgives sin and overlooks the rebellion of the remnant who belong to him? He does not stay angry forever, because he takes delight in mercy.

verses.kjv: He will turn again, he will have compassion upon us; he will subdue our iniquities; and thou wilt cast all their sins into the depths of the sea.
verses.ct: He will once again show us compassion. He will trample our sins underfoot and hurl all our wrongdoing into the depths of the sea.

verses.kjv: Thou wilt perform the truth to Jacob, and the mercy to Abraham, which thou hast sworn unto our fathers from the days of old.
verses.ct: You will show faithfulness to Jacob and mercy to Abraham, just as you promised our ancestors in ancient times.
